instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.820-3462A: What is 820-3462A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 13" Retina No s5 rails
threads.message: Hi, have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 13" Retina Board that used to have a shorted SMC. Well I finally tracked one down an replaced it. Board still won't work though. It does have the orange light (so 3V42 definitely working) and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is normal. Any suggesting? Which rails should I post?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 13" Retina No s5 rails
threads.message:
Did you solder SMC from 3462 board too?

Post basic signals, like <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>.
Be sure to use proper charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 13" Retina No s5 rails
threads.message:
Yup, identical board. 

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.38V
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is also 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 13" Retina No s5 rails
threads.message: Used a genuine 85w charger for these measurements

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 13" Retina No s5 rails
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is also 0V"
Looks like SMC issue.
You may need to reball/change it.

Check first L4901 and <RESISTOR>R4902</RESISTOR>.
Post <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>1V2_S5</SIGNAL>.
Inspect for corrosion around Y5010; surrounding components and traces...
